subSection.paragraph:
Two new species of genus
Metanigrus Tsaur, Yang & Wilson, 1986
(Fulgoromorpha, Meenoplidae ),
M. afflatus
sp. nov.
from Hainan Province and
M. angularus
sp. nov.
from Yunnan Province , are described and illustrated, bringing the total number of species within the genus to 8. An updated checklist and identification key to known species of
Metanigrus
are provided.
Key words: Fulgoroidea , distribution , Meenoplinae , morphology

The genus
Metanigrus
( Meenoplidae : Meenoplinae) was established by
Tsaur et al . (1986)
for
M. yami Tsaur, Yang & Wilson, 1986
( type species) from Taiwan . Liu & Qin (2020) and Lv et al . (2021) added one and four species to the genus from China , respectively. The genus now includes six known species. Herein, two new
Metanigrus species
,
M. afflatus
sp. nov.
and
M. angularus
sp. nov.
, are described from China . An updated checklist and identification key to species of the genus are given as well as a map of their geographic distributions.

The morphological terminology follows Bourgoin (1987) for male genitalia,
Bourgoin et al . (2015)
for wing venation. Body length was measured from the apex of vertex to tip of forewing. All measurements are in millimeters (mm). Dried specimens were used for descriptions and illustrations, external morphology was observed under a stereoscopic microscope and characters were measured with an ocular micrometer. Photographs were taken with the NIKON SMZ 25 and VHX-1000E digital cameras, and multiple layers were stacked using Helicon Focus 6. External morphology and drawings were visualized and created with the aid of a Leica MZ 12.5 stereomicroscope. The photographs and illustrations were scanned with a CanoScan LiDE 200 and imported into Adobe Photoshop 6.0 for labeling and plate composition. The dissected male genitalia are preserved in glycerin in small plastic tubes pinned together with the specimens. The distribution map was generated with ARCGIS 10.7.
The types and the specimens examined are deposited in the Institute of Entomology, Guizhou University, Guiyang, Guizhou Province , China (GUGC).

subSubSection.paragraph: Coloration. General color grayish yellow ( Figs 1, 2 ), with thin white wax powder. Upper part of frons grayish brown, middle and basal parts yellowish brown. Clypeus yellowish brown. Eyes black, ocelli grayish white. Pronotum white, middle aera with 2 faint yellowish brown spots. Mesonotum fuscous. Forewings with black spots, veins brown. Hindwings hyaline.
